titleStmt.title: Digital description of MS. Laud Or. 98

msItem.author: Ghazzālī, 1058-1111 אלע’זאלי, מחמד בן מחמד
msItem.title: Kaṿanot ha-filosofim (Doctrines of the Philosophers, Maḳâṣid al-falâsifat), part I
כונות הפילוספים (חלק א)

msItem.author: Alcalá, Pedro de (Petrus Hispanus)
msItem.title: Compendium of a logical treatise
קצור ההגיון של פטרוס היספנוס
msItem.note: According to Steinschneider's Prospectus begins as in Wolf iv, p. 826, ends .ועל זה הוקשו הכלב והזאב כמו שאמרנו
Other translations are entitled טרטאט or טרקטאץ; cf. M. Steinschneider, HÜ, 473.

listBibl.bibl: Neubauer, Adolf, Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, 1886), no. 1341.

Beit-Arié, Malachi and R.A. May (eds), Catalogue of the Hebrew manuscripts in the Bodleian Library; Supplement of Addenda and Corrigenda to Vol. I (A. Neubauer’s Catalogue) (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1994), no. 1341.

msItem.author: Maimonides, Moses, 1135-1204 משה בן מימון
msItem.title: Milot ha-Higayon (Treatise on Logical Terminology)
מלות ההגיון
msItem.note: Mosheh Ibn Tibbon's translation, finished Kislev 5015=1254. Next comes an appendix headed: סבת הסתירה או ההפך הנמצא בספר מן הספרים

msItem.title: Sefer ha-Higayon
ספר ההגיון
msItem.note: Appendix to it at the end headed: חידושין לספר מאמרות מן קטאגוריאש

msItem.author: Ghazzālī, 1058-1111 אלע’זאלי, מחמד בן מחמד
msItem.title: Kaṿanot ha-filosofim (Doctrines of the Philosophers, Maḳâṣid al-falâsifat), parts II-III
כונות הפילוספים (חלק ב-ג)
msItem.note: Translator of Part II (incomplete) is anonym, part III was translated by Yitshak Albalag.

supportDesc.foliation: [A description of the numbering system(s) used to count the leaves or pages in a codex]
supportDesc.collation: 10 quires of 12, 14, 16 and 18 leaves, Latin characters catchwords in the lower margin of every verso, sometimes decorated

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding, blind-tooled, repaired; gold-tooled coat of arms of Archbishop Laud in the middle.

history.provenance: Notes on fol. [ii]v: "Jacobi Armachani (?)"; "... Oppenh. 1173 (...586)" "Triplicam literaru[m] Alphabetam. videre licet paginis 73 et 177."; "Liber Guilielmi Laud Archiepiscopi Cantaur[iensis] et Cancellari Universitatis Oxon[iensis] 1633"
history.acquisition: Donated to the Library by Archbishop William Laud (see Summary Catalogue, vol.II, part 1, pp.13-14).

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vol. I, by Adolf Neubauer, Oxford 1886, No. 1341., Catalogue of the Hebrew manuscripts in the Bodleian Library; Supplement of Addenda and Corrigenda to Vol. I No. 1341. and on the data of the Institute of Microfilmed Hebrew Manuscripts, National Library of Israel with additional enhancements by the cataloguer.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.

listBibl.bibl: Neubauer, Adolf, Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, 1886), no. 1341.

Beit-Arié, Malachi and R.A. May (eds), Catalogue of the Hebrew manuscripts in the Bodleian Library; Supplement of Addenda and Corrigenda to Vol. I (A. Neubauer’s Catalogue) (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1994), no. 1341.

taxonomy.desc: General index of Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vol. ii, by Adolf Neubauer and Arthur Ernest Cowley, Oxford 1906
Catalogue section of Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vols. i-ii, by Adolf Neubauer, by Adolf Neubauer and Arthur Ernest Cowley, Oxford 1886, 1906
Catalogue of the Institute of Microfilmed Hebrew Manuscripts, Jewish National and University Library, Jerusalem
